title: Efficient Non-malleable Codes and Key-Derivation for Poly-size Tampering Circuits.
abstract: Non-malleable codes, defined by Dziembowski, Pietrzak and Wichs (ICS ’10), provide roughly the following guarantee: if a codeword c encoding some message x is tampered to c′ = f(c) such that c′ ≠ c, then the tampered message x′ contained in c′ reveals no information about x. Non-malleable codes have applications to immunizing cryptosystems against tampering attacks and related-key attacks.
